content.title: Pseudoxanthoma Elasticum (PXE)
content.definition: Autosomal recessive connective tissue disorder caused by ABCC6 gene mutations, characterized by progressive calcification and fragmentation of elastic fibers in skin, eyes, and cardiovascular system.

genetics.mechanism: Defective transmembrane transporter leading to ectopic mineralization

vascular_involvement.imaging: Extensive arterial calcification disproportionate to age

approach: Limited endovascular options due to calcification

clinical_pearls: Young patient + severe calcification = think PXE
Angioid streaks on fundoscopy are characteristic
GI bleeding from arterial calcification is common
